newsitem.title: GERMANY: UK's Britannia to fly ex-Germany to Caribbean.
newsitem.headline: UK's Britannia to fly ex-Germany to Caribbean.

text.p: UK charter airline Britannia Airways is to launch services ex-Germany from November, German tour operator Paul Guenther Tours GmbH said.
The British airline, part of the Thomson Travel Group, will fly from Cologne and Berlin to the Caribbean and Mexico under a 24 million mark contract, the operator said in a statement.
The three times a week flights with new Boeing 767-300 aircraft will fly to Santo Domingo and Puerto Plata in the Dominican Republic and to Cancun and Puerto Vallarta in Mexico, it added.
Britannia said that last year it flew 7.7 million passengers from Britain, Ireland, the Netherlands and Belgium to over 100 destinations, the statement said.
The airline's fleet comprises 19 Boeing 757s, six B767-200s and three new B767-300s, it added.

The airline's general sales manager, Geoff Bailey, said in a statement: "Liberalisation of air transport in the European Union in recent years has meant that ever more leading European tour operators have contracted us to carry out their flights."
Paul Guenther Tours is a medium-sized tour operator specialising in holiday packages to the U.S., Caribbean and Mexico.
